explanations.machine learning: The paper explicitly mentions the use of machine learning methods such as bagged adaptive boosting (BAB), averaged neural network (avNNet), heteroscedastic discriminant analysis (HAD), and rotation forest (RotationF) to assess groundwater vulnerability.
explanations.supervised learning: The methods used (BAB, avNNet, HAD, RotationF) are supervised learning techniques, as they involve training models on labeled data to predict groundwater vulnerability.
explanations.classification: The study involves classifying groundwater vulnerability, which is a classification task where models predict categories or classes of vulnerability.
explanations.regression: The study may also involve regression tasks, as predicting spatial variations in groundwater quality can involve continuous output variables.
explanations.neural network: The paper mentions the use of averaged neural network (avNNet), indicating the application of neural networks in the study.
explanations.ensemble method: The paper discusses the use of an ensemble method, specifically a stacking ensemble approach, to improve model performance.
